wikipedia_page.main:
James McFadzean (20 August 1938 – 24 February 2016) was a Scottish footballer who played as a forward.
McFadzean is best known for his part in the 1964-65 title winning Kilmarnock squad while making 128 appearances for the Rugby Park club. He had earlier spells with Heart of Midlothian, St Mirren and Raith Rovers and later joined Ayr United where he ended his playing career.McFadzean died on 24 February 2016 at the age of 77.

response: *24 February: Jim McFadzean, 77, Heart of Midlothian, St Mirren, Raith Rovers, Kilmarnock and Ayr United defender.Tributes pour in for Kilmarnock FC legend Jim McFadzean who has passed away
*Jim McFadzean, 77, Scottish footballer (Kilmarnock, Heart of Midlothian).Jim McFadzean

In the second half, Eintracht started strongly but were unable to find an equaliser before Jackie McGrory's free-kick was headed into the goal by Jim McFadzean in the 52nd minute which reduced the aggregate arrears to one. McIlroy then thought he had levelled the tie on aggregate but his goal was disallowed for offside.
